result.execSummary:
The defendant Abel A. Sauceda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abel A. Sauceda

ADDRESS INFO for Abel A. Sauceda

Prior: 1001 82nd Street $108, Kenosha, WI 53143

Defendant Abel A. Sauceda appeared with Attorney Hans P Koesser.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Amended Information filed; reading waived.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Misd DC-DA, of the amended info; found guilty by the court.  
Sentence:
82 days in the KCJ, with 82 days sentence credit given.  Time served.  Court costs waived.  No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given.
to Use "Other Acts" Evidence at Trial filed by ADA Jason Zapf

Defendant Abel A. Sauceda appeared with Attorney Hans P Koesser.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jason R Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  State requesting an adjournment of trial due to a witness problem and would like time to file an other acts motion.  Def. Atty move for dismissal and bond reduction.  Court grants State's motion for adjounrment and denied def's motion to dismiss and the bond motion.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Jury selection scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Hans P. Koesser not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jason R Zapf appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  No Record.  Atty Koesser is tied up in Br 6.  Def. sent back to the jail.  Speedy trial demand was filed.  Bond motion to be heard at trial on 5/27/14.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction filed by Atty Hans Koesser
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Zapf.
Jury trial on May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am before Br 4 due to speedy trial demand filed on 4/4/14.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hans Koesser. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-8-14 @ 10:00am. Demand for speedy trial made by def. Bond continued.

1:39 pm    Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk:  KZ.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on  4-4-14 @ 8:30 am.  $1000 cash bond set with conditions.
